magpie.optimization.analytics

Class OptimizationStatistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • magpie.optimization.analytics.OptimizationStatistics
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Printable

    public class OptimizationStatistics
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, Printable
    Basic statistics about the performance optimization algorithms. Useful in cases where the correct answers both are known and yet-undiscovered.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • SuccessFilter

        protected BaseDatasetFilter SuccessFilter
        Defines when an entry is considered successful

      • NumberTopEntries

        public int NumberTopEntries
        Number of top entries to select

      • TopEntries

        protected Dataset TopEntries
        A list of top entries that optimization algorithm is designed to find. Only used if the search space associated with the algorithm being evaluated contains the measured properties of each possible candidate.

      • SuccessfulEntries

        protected Dataset SuccessfulEntries
        A list of entries that pass the SuccessFilter (if defined)

      • IterationsEvaluated

        protected int IterationsEvaluated
        Number of iterations that have been evaluated

        Number of top entries found in the population for each iteration

    • Method Detail

      • setSuccessFilter

        public void setSuccessFilter(BaseDatasetFilter filter)
        Define a filter to define when the optimization algorithm has found an acceptable entry.
        Parameters:
        filter - Desired filter

      • setNumberTopEntries

        public void setNumberTopEntries(int NumberTopEntries)
        Define the number of top entries to hold for statistical purposes.
        Parameters:
        NumberTopEntries - Desired number

      • evaluate

        public void evaluate(BaseOptimizer Optimizer)
        Evaluate the performance of an optimizer. Produces statistics for each iteration
        Parameters:
        Optimizer - Optimization run to be analyzed

      • evaluateEntries

        protected void evaluateEntries(Dataset Generation,
                   Dataset Population,
                   BaseEntryRanker Ranker,
                   int IterationNumber)
        Given the new entries for a generation and the total population so far, calculate the statistics for this generation
        Parameters:
        Generation - New entries added this iteration
        Population - Total population so far
        Ranker - Objective function used during optimization
        IterationNumber - Which iteration we are one

      • collectAnswers

        protected void collectAnswers(BaseOptimizer Optimizer)
        If answers to optimization problem are already known, collect them. This requires that the optimizer being evaluated has measured properties in the search space.
        Parameters:
        Optimizer - Optimization run to draw results from

      • findTopEntries

        protected void findTopEntries(Dataset searchSpace,
                  BaseEntryRanker ranker)
        Set the top entry list with a known list
        Parameters:
        searchSpace - Search space from which to pull top entries
        ranker - Objective function to use for ranking entries

      • findSuccesses

        protected void findSuccesses(Dataset searchSpace)
        Find all entries in the search space that pass the success filter. If there are no measured classes in the search space dataset or no success filter is defined, will set SuccessfulEntries to null.
        Parameters:
        searchSpace - Search space

      • allocateResults

        protected void allocateResults(int NumberGenerations)
        Before evaluation, allocate result arrays
        Parameters:
        NumberGenerations - Number of generations to expect

      • printResults

        public java.lang.String printResults()
        Print out all results into a neatly-formated table
        Returns:
        Table as string

      • getHeader

        protected java.lang.String getHeader()
        Print out a header that has all statistics which have been calculated. It will look something like:
        IterationNumber EvaluatedSoFar BestSoFar...
        Returns:
        This header as a string

      • printData

        protected java.lang.String printData(int i)
        Print out the data for a single iteration
        Parameters:
        i - Iteration number to print
        Returns:
        String containing all available data (blank if missing)

      • printDescription

        public java.lang.String printDescription(boolean htmlFormat)
        Description copied from interface: Printable
        Print full name of object, and a simple description of the options. This description should print enough information to reproduce how this object was created, but not necessarily enough to run it (e.g., coefficients for the model).

        Example: For a model training a separate WekaRegression for intermetallics

        magpie.models.regression.SplitRegression

        Splitter: AllMetalsSplitter
        All Metals: magpie.models.regression.WekaRegression trees.REPTree
        Contains Nonmetal: magpie.regression.LASSORegreession -maxterms 2
        Specified by:
        printDescription in interface Printable
        Parameters:
        htmlFormat - Whether format for output to an HTML page (e.g., <div> to create indentation) or for printing to screen.
        Returns:
        String describing the model
        See Also:
        #printModel()
